question.questionA: Leaves palmate or palmately lobed; beak of fruit splitting into arched or coiled sections.
question.questionB: Leaves pinnate or pinnately lobed; beak of fruit splitting into spiral sections.
Sepals erect and partly incurved at the apex.

question.questionA: All leaves deeply divided into narrow linear or lanceolate segments.
question.questionB: At least the lower leaves broad, rotund or palmately lobed.

question.questionA: Peduncles  5-20 mm; pedicels 5-15 mm; petals c. 5 mm, notched, deep pink.
question.questionB: Peduncles 2-12 cm; pedicels 2-6 cm; petals  7-9 mm, not notched, pale purplish pink.

question.questionA: Lower  leaves divided  to  less  than half way; petals 5-8 mm, pink, rounded at the apex or very slightly notched.
question.questionB: Lower leaves divided to more than half way; petals  3-7 mm, bright rosy purple, deeply notched.

question.questionA: Leaves palmately  lobed,  bright yellowish green, shining; petals 8-9 mm, limb shorter than claw.
question.questionB: Leaves compound, dark green not shining, leaflets palmately divided; petals 6-9 mm, limb longer than claw.

question.questionA: Some or all leaves shallowly lobed to less than half the width of the blade.
Small mat-forming perennial; leaves 1 cm, crenate; flowers solitary; petals white or pink with dark pink veins.
question.questionB: Erect annuals or biennials 10-40 cm; flowers in clusters of three to eight; petals pink, veins not distinctly coloured.

question.questionA: Petals pale pink; pit at apex of fruit without a furrow beneath it.
question.questionB: Petals deep pink; pit at apex of fruit with a furrow beneath it.

question.questionA: Plants with glandular hairs, smelling of musk; leaves pinnate.
question.questionB: Plants not smelling of musk; leaves bipinnate or tripinnate.

question.questionA: Leaves bipinnate; petals pink, the upper two often smaller than the lower three.
question.questionB: Leaves tripinnate, longer segments alternating with shorter segments; petals lilac, all equal.
